alert.note: Alert for Furnas; Gosper (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 28 at 3:29AM CDT until October 29 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 7 AM CDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Snow and a bit of mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. Little to no ice accumulation is expected. * WHERE...Gosper and Furnas Counties. * WHEN...From 10 AM this morning to 7 AM CDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Several bands of light to moderate snow, possibly briefly mixed with sleet, will move through the advisory area at various times from late this morning into the overnight. This will not be a continuous precipitation event, but rather off and on in nature. While air temperatures will be plenty cold for snow and sleet pellets, ground temperatures still remain relatively warm and it may take a while for snowfall to accumulate. However, this may also contribute to slippery road conditions if snow melts and then refreezes on area surfaces, especially after sunset this evening.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
